page.title: 14WALKING IN WATER CUM JOLLY
page.content: {WALKS.}Cressbrook Mill to Water cum Jolly. This special walk on a wide level gravel path along the banks of the river Wye affords freedom for children and dogs,and gives easy access for wheelchairs.On the right are deciduous woods, and across the river the land rises steeply to rough hill pasture.Spectacular limestone rocks are reflected in the dam at Water cum Jolly;a quiet sanctuary for birds such as coot,water-hens,ducks, dippers,grebe and the rarely seen kingfisher.Frogs spawn among the reeds and forget-me-nots. {WHITE PEAK.}The dales are peculiar to Derbyshire being deep and narrow,the sides covered by outcrops of rocky limestone. {MILLERS DALE.}Here the walk is along the disused railway line which is also used as a cycle track.
